main event: A silver-white circular object was observed moving in a straight up-and-down motion, followed by bright, flashing red and blue lights, in Massillon, Ohio on July 4, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as very plane-like and made a quick departure.
Multiple witnesses, including the witness, their neighbors, and another man named Overton, reported seeing the same object on that day.
The object was described as being bright, silvery, and circular, and was flying at a relatively low altitude but at a high speed.
The witness estimated the object was about 1/2 mile or less away from their location.
The witness estimated the object's speed to be between 200-300 miles per hour.
